com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.cap

Class CapFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gemalto.idp.mobile.otp.cap.CapFactory

  • public final class CapFactory
extends java.lang.Object
    A factory for creating objects that produce or affect CAP (or its relatives) OTPs.

    • Method Detail

      • createCapDevice

        public final CapDevice createCapDevice(CapToken token)
                                throws IdpException
        Creates a Hardware or Software CAP device for the given CAP token.

        Warning! Currently Ezio Mobile SDK library only supports Software CAP device.

        If the token is soft, i.e Token.isSoft() is true, the default CAP settings returned via createSoftCapSettings() are used, otherwise the device settings are used.

        Parameters:
        token - the CAP token
        Returns:
        the CAP device
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - when the token type is unknown
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        Since:
        4.0

      • createSoftCapSettings

        public final SoftCapSettings createSoftCapSettings()
        Create a mutable copy of the default CAP settings used for soft tokens.
        Returns:
        new Mutable CAP settings based on the default cap settings
        Since:
        4.0

      • createSoftCapDevice

        public final CapDevice createSoftCapDevice(SoftCapToken token,
                                           SoftCapSettings settings)
                                    throws IdpException
        Creates a Software CAP device for the given token using the given settings. This method may only be used for soft tokens, i.e Token.isSoft() is true.
        Parameters:
        token - the CAP token
        settings - the CAP settings
        Returns:
        the CAP device
        Throws:
        IdpException - this is generic exception, you can directly catch this exception or catch each specific exception below.
        IdpStorageException - when there is a database operation failure.
        DeviceFingerprintException - when the token's fingerprint checksum does not match.
        PasswordManagerException - when the TOKEN domain is not logged in (using one of the password managers)
        Since:
        4.0
